attributes.action: Be able to delete/deactivate an account that has been hacked.
attributes.additional_details: This is very scary for a lot of people where personal details about yourself can be revealed online and may be used against vulnerable people. A lot of people have been blackmailed with personal/private messages and there should be something set in stone where you don’t need to wait days/weeks for a response and can take immediate action if your account were to be hacked. We should be able to provide any old information to be able to deactivate/ delete an account.
attributes.background: Many people online get hacked where they are unable to retrieve their account as their email address and phone number have been removed by a hacker. I would like it so if you can provide online any old details such as your email and phone number you can permanently delete or deactivate an account.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how people access online accounts, including when these have been hacked, are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.
